Title: Stephenson Way Play Area
Description:
The Council has successfully secured £60,000 of external funding to enhance an established play area at Stephenson Way in Corby and is now seeking a suitably qualified and experienced Contractor to undertake the scheme, within a tight timescale.
The Works shall consist of the following -
Removal and appropriate disposal off-site of all unwanted equipment and features (including foundations) comprising -
Wooden Bridge
Boulders
Wooden Train x 2 (Engine & Carriage)
Tunnel
Red Spinning Post
Wooden Sleepers
Play Area Sign
Make good resulting ground, including fill / consolidate voids and level
Design new area based on an "outer space" theme to compliment remaining equipment
Prepare ground to receive new design, including site strip, any required land-drainage, stabilisation of soft spots, concrete edging kerbs, geotextile membrane and suitable granular sub-base
Supply & install new equipment and features in concrete foundations, all as per manufacturer's recommendations
Supply & lay quality EPDM wet-pour safety surfacing in colours to suit design
Supply & install an A0 size sign to be displayed on the Park boundary. This sign is to be metal and mounted on 2 metal posts. The design and content is to be agreed with the Council before installation. An example can be seen in Appendix 1
Provide an independent Post Installation Safety Inspection Report
Attachments: 02. Document 2 - Specification - Stephenson Way Play Area V5.docx 03. Document 3 - Preliminaries And General Conditions V3.pdf Draft Terms and Conditions.pdf 01. Document 1 - Instructions To Bidders Stephenson Way Play Area V4.docx 04. Document 4 - Response Document Stephenson Way Play Area V2.docx

Title: Cheam Recreation Ground - Supply & Installation of Trim Trail Equipment
Description:
REQUEST FOR QUOTATION OPPORTUNITY

CHEAM RECREATION GROUND - Supply and Install Trim Trail

The London Borough of Sutton (Sutton Council) is seeking quotations from suitably qualified organisations for the provision of a Trim Trail at Cheam Recreation Ground.

The contract will initially be for a period of 2-3 Months commencing on contract award 12th May 2017. 

The Council is tendering this quotation through the London Tenders e-tendering portal. Prospective bidders are advised to register their interest by going to https://www.londontenders.org/procontract/supplier.nsf

Sutton Council currently contracts with a diverse group of voluntary, statutory, partnership, social enterprise, consortium, mutuals and private sector providers. This list is not exhaustible and encourages a range of organisations, regardless of size, to apply for this provision.  

The Council shall not be bound to accept the lowest cost nor any quotation, and reserves the right to accept all or part of your bid. The award of contract shall be based on the most economically advantageous quotation submitted. 

Deadline for submission of a completed Quotation Questionnaire is Tuesday 2nd May 2017 12 midday.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [HAGS SMP Ltd|Clockhouse Nurseries Clockhouse Lane Egham Surrey TW20 8PG|||No|No]

Title: ESPO 115 : Supply and Installation of Play Equipment to Radnor Park
Description:
Further competition under ESPO framework 115 "Playground Equipment - Outdoor" for the Supply and Provision of Playground Equipment to / for Shepway District Council at Radnor Park, Folkestone.


Shepway District Council anticipate that the call off will be in force for a fixed period of FOUR months; commencing 1st April 2017 and elapsing 26th July 2017.


 Shepway District Council would like to engage a company to design and deliver play equipment, safety surfacing and hard landscaping supporting Radnor Park's regeneration, a flagship project for the Shepway district:


• Radnor Park play area - community-led project to redevelop and modernise the upper Radnor Park Play area.


• Radnor Park landscaping - integrated landscaping programme to bring outdoor seating, walkways, planting and play area into one cohesive, user experience  and visual journey.


 This is an excellent opportunity for a company to be involved in this exciting  community led project, Radnor Park Community Group have raised a huge amount of money in order to deliver the play area which will receive much publicity and have a Grand Opening in July 2017. As a community project, budgets are tight and the project board is keen to secure a stunning, innovative value for money  solution for generations of residents and visitors to enjoy for years to come.

Title: TENDER FOR THE DESIGN, SUPPLY AND INSTALLATION OF A MULTI - USE GAMES AREA (MUGA) EQUIPMENT UNDER ESPO FRAMEWORK AGREEMENT 115
Description:
Basingstoke and Deane Borough Council ('the Council') is seeking to provide a new multi - use games area (MUGA) at Popley Community Park, Popley, Basingstoke (see location plan at Appendix 1)

The MUGA will be safe, engaging, fun, accessible and suitable for the environment and will be fully aligned to the commitment set out in the Council Plan to provide great facilities for its residents. The scheme should reflect the views expressed in the Popley MUGA consultation report document (Appendix I).  

A budget of up to £85,000.00 is available for this project.

THE PROJECT MUST TO BE COMPLETED BY THE 24TH MARCH 2017 AT THE LATEST - THIS IS A MANDATORY REQUIREMENT.

The Council utilised an electronic tendering tool to manage this procurement and communicate with Tenderers.  Accordingly, there were no hard copy documents issued to Tenderers and all communications with the Council, including the submission of Tenderers' Responses, were conducted via the ProContract system, which can be accessed using the following link:
	
https://sebp.due-north.com/

Wycombe District Council invites tenders for the construction of play facilities at Saunderton Lodge, Saunderton, Bucks.

The play area shall cater predominantly for an age range of 0-14 year olds. Design, implementation and supervision of the works shall be carried out by and at the expense of the contractor.

Title: Exeter Open Space Play Area – Equipment & Installation
Description:
Corby Borough Council is seeking a suitably skilled, qualified and experienced contractor to supply and install play equipment at the Exeter Open Space Play Area, Counts Farm Road, Corby NN18 8BH. 

The tender price must include all supply and installation costs, an independent Post Installation Inspection Report and a sign to be displayed in the Park.

Contractors must have at least four years experience in supplying and installing play equipment, have membership of the Association of Play Industries and have a turnover of at least £50k.

All equipment supplied must confirm to relevant standards, including BSEN 1176 and 1177.

Tenders will be awarded on the evaluation of Price (40%) and Quality (60%).

Tender documents, including Tender Instructions and Response documents and the Specification may be obtained from Kevin Williams.

Please note there is a fixed sum for this contract and bids in excess of the available funding will not be considered. 

Please ensure that you have made a copy of this advert and any relevant information or documents BEFORE the ‘Document Available Until’ date, this advert will not be accessible on or after this date. You then have until the ‘Submission Return By’ date to respond.
Contact Address 1: Culture and Leisure Department, Corby Borough Council, 2nd Floor,
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [HAGS-SMP Ltd|Clockhouse Nurseries, Clockhouse Lane East, Egham, Surrey, TW20 8PG|||No|No]

Title: Provision of Outdoor Play Equipment
Description:
Daventry District Council has a number of outside children’s play areas. We are looking to improve children’s experience and fun in these areas with new equipment. 

The Council is seeking to replace outdoor Play Equipment in a number of locations and the tender is divided into two separate Lots. 

Lot 1.
For play equipment at Wimbourne Place, Ashby Fields (approx. value £90 000)
Lot 2
For play equipment at 6 individual sites. (approx. values £30 000)

It is advised that suppliers should visit the sites in order to propose equipment that complements existing play equipment to maximise the total Value of Play for the appropriate age range.
The two Lots will be treated separately so tenders can be submitted for just either or both of them.  
Contractors able to respond to either or both Lots should note that all equipment must be installed by end of March 2016.

The document below contains Information and Instructions and can be downloaded for further details of the opportunity.

Interested providers should request tender documentation by e-mailing asutherland@daventrydc.gov.uk. 

Submissions must be returned no later than 12:00 noon on Friday 30th October 2015.

Title: East Carlton Country Park Play Area
Description:
Corby Borough Council is seeking a suitably skilled, qualified and experienced contractor to supply and install play equipment to an existing play area and remove other pieces of specified equipment from a designated site at East Carlton Country Park, Corby.

The tender price must include all supply and installation costs, removal costs and an independent Post Installation Inspection Report and a sign to be displayed in the Park.

All equipment supplied must confirm to relevant standards, including BSEN 1176 and 1177.

Bidders must have a turnover of at least twice the contract value (£75k x 2).

Tenders will be awarded on the basis of bidders’ responses to a set of evaluation questions. These will include questions about the design of the equipment and the installation process.  

Please note: there is a fixed sum of £75,000 for this contract. The Council is seeking tenders that maximise this available funding. Hence, bidders will be asked to demonstrate how best they will make use of this sum rather than to compete on price. Therefore, ‘price’ will not be scored as part of the evaluation.

Tenders in excess of the available funding will not be considered.

Please download the tender documents from this advert - or from the corresponding advert on Source Northamaptonshire  - www.sourcenorthamptonshire.co.uk

Please ensure you register your interest for this tender by emailing Kevin Williams at Kevin.Williams@Corby.gov.uk. This will ensure you are copied into all relevant communication concering the tender, such as clarification responses.
Contact Address 2: Culture and Leisure Department, 2nd Floor, Deene House, New Post Office

Title: Framework Contract for Landscaping and Associated Works
Description: The intention behind the framework is to establish multi-discipline Landscaping framework.This framework is being established primarily to support Peabody with the redevelopment of Thamesmead.  Peabody acquired Thamesmead in 2014 and are developing ambitious plans for its regeneration and development.  A key part of Thamesmead's identity are its existing extensive landscape assets and it is recognised that the development of both these and new areas of landscape and public realm will be critical to ensuring the long-term success of the plans.Full details can be found at - www.thamesmeadnow.org.ukIn addition to the requirements defined above the framework will also be open to Member organisations of Procurement for Housing.

Title: 115_17 Outdoor Play Area
Description:
An ESPO only, national framework for the design, supply, delivery, installation and maintenance of Outdoor Playground Equipment, Outdoor Fitness Equipment, Skate/BMX Parks, Parkour, Multi Use Games Areas, Water Play Areas and Sports Areas including associated services such as landscaping, fencing and outdoor furniture.  Delivery and Installation direct to customers' sites.
Lot No: 1 - Playground Equipment - Schools / Smaller Authority Market (Low Number of Suppliers)
Lot No: 2 - Playground Equipment - Larger Authority / Large Projects (Higher Number of Suppliers)
Lot No: 3 - Natural Play Areas / Timber Equipment
Lot No: 4.1 - Multi Use Games Area (MUGA) - Steel - Macadam Surface
Lot No: 4.2 - Multi Use Games Area (MUGA) - Steel - Synthetic Grass
Lot No: 5.1 - Multi Use Games Area (MUGA) - Timber - Macadam Surface
Lot No: 5.2 - Multi Use Games Area (MUGA) - Timber - Synthetic Grass
Lot No: 6.1 - Skate / BMX Parks - In-Situ Wetpour Concrete
Lot No: 6.2 - Skate / BMX Parks - Pre-Fabricated Units - Concrete
Lot No: 6.3 - Skate / BMX Parks - Pre-Fabricated Units - Metal
Lot No: 7 - Outdoor Fitness Equipment
Lot No: 8 - Bespoke Play Equipment
Lot No: 9 - Wetpour Rubber Surfacing
Lot No: 10.1 - Sport and Play Surface - Synthetic Artificial Grass
Lot No: 10.2 - Sport and Play Surface - Needle Punched Carpet
Lot No: 11 - 3G Football Pitches
Lot No: 12 - Long Jump / Triple Jump Runway and Sand Pit
Lot No: 13.1 - Cricket - Artificial Grass Pitch
Lot No: 13.2 - Cricket - Practice Net Systems
Lot No: 14.1 - Tennis Courts - Porous Macadam
Lot No: 14.2 - Tennis Courts - Synthetic Grass
Lot No: 15 - Inspection Reports - Play Equipment, Including Surfacing and Outdoor Sports
The framework agreement has the option to extend for up to a further 12 months.  The total estimated value stated includes the option period.
As a Central Purchasing Body as defined by the EU Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU, the Framework Agreement is open for use by Public Bodies (defined https://www.espo.org/ESPO/media/Documents/FAQs/ESPO-s_powers_to_trade__website_-2016-12-22.pdf) that also fall into one of the following classifications of user throughout all administrative regions of the UK: Local Authorities; Educational Establishments (including Academies); Central Government Departments and Agencies; Police, Fire & Rescue and Coastguard Emergency Services; NHS and HSC Bodies, including Ambulance Services; Registered Charities; Registered Social Landlords; or any public body established by or under the Scotland Act 1998 or any Act of the Scottish Parliament. Details of the classification of end user establishments and geographical areas is available on: http://www.espo.org/About-us-%281%29/FAQs/Legal
An eAuction process may be used to award subsequent call off contracts following the reopening of competition among the parties to the Framework Agreement.

Title: ADCQ15-004 Ashfield District Council Supply of children’s play equipment at Greenwells Park, Selston, Nottinghamshire.
Description:
Ashfield District Council is seeking to obtain quotations for the supply only of children’s play equipment for Greenwells Park in Selston, Nottingham.

The contract will be broken down into thirteen separate Lots. Tenderers are invited to bid for any number of Lots and shall provide separate prices for each individual Lot.

This procurement is being undertaken as a further competition through the ESPO Framework 115 Outdoor Playground Equipment.
